IdentityCredentialError.summary: NOTE Experimental The IdentityCredentialError interface of the {{domxref("FedCM API", "FedCM API", "", "nocode")}} describes an authentication error indicating that the user agent did not receive an identity assertion after the user has requested to use a federated account. This can happen if the client is unauthorized or if the server is temporarily unavailable, for example.

remarks.para: Browsers can use this error type to show the error message in the user interface.

IdentityCredentialErrorUrl.summary: NOTE Experimental The url read-only property of the interface is the URL pointing to human-readable information about the error to display to users, such as how to fix the error or contact customer service.
IdentityCredentialErrorUrl.value: A string indicating the URL for more information about the error.

IdentityCredentialErrorError.summary: NOTE Experimental The error read-only property of the interface is either one of the values listed in the OAuth 2.0 specified error list or an arbitrary string giving more information about the error.
IdentityCredentialErrorError.value: One of the values listed in the OAuth 2.0 specified error list or an arbitrary string.

IdentityCredentialErrorIdentityCredentia.summary: NOTE Experimental The IdentityCredentialError() constructor creates a new object.
